docs.title: Themes and Vibes
docs.text:
Pulp adventure refers to stories, films, and games featuring high-octane, action-packed narratives set in exotic locales, with a focus on rugged heroes battling villains and seeking lost artifacts.

Key Characteristics

  • Exotic settings
  • Rugged heroes
  • Lost artifacts and ancient secrets
  • High-stakes action
  • Villains and danger
  • Fast-paced & dramatic

Noir intrigue refers to the complex, shadowy plots and mysterious, often morally ambiguous situations found in the film noir genre, characterized by themes of betrayal, crime, and existential dread

Key Characteristics

  • Complex plots
  • Moral ambiguity

Media Touchstones Media touchstones: Casablanca, From Hell, The Maltese Falcon, The Mummy, Pirates of the Caribbean, Raiders of the Lost Ark, Fifth Element, Inglourious Basterds, etc.

docs.title: House Rules
docs.text:
• Changes - Players can retract or change things their characters did up until the point they learn the consequences of their actions. Once I describe what happens as a result, it’s too late for the players to change their minds.
  • Dice Rolling - Players must roll their dice in view of everyone, unless directed by the DM otherwise. Any dice that rolls off the table or is cocked needs to be rerolled.
  • Flanking - When a player or creature is flanked, meaning having an opponent on both sides of them within 5ft, the flankers receive a +2 to attack rolls.

docs.title: Rooftop Rendezvous
docs.text:
Sergeant Germaine Vilroy, of the Sharn City Watch, is waiting at the top of Lyrandar Tower, Upper Central District for her contacts to arrive so she can give them their mission. Cassian ir'Bellona, S.A.M., and Caelin arrive via airship. Moments later the two Sharn locals, Renée and Cligs, arrive via skycoach. They each introduce themselves and Vilroy gives them the following information:

  • A warforged named Coal had reached out to report a crime being committed in Old Sharn.
  • She wants the party to meet with Coal first and see if what she says adds up. She is worried that, with her status as a Watch sergeant, her presence will call undue attention and endanger Coal.
  • She offers them 25gp upfront and another 25gp for completing the mission
  • She setup a meeting place at the Cog Carnival in High Walls, Lower Tavick's Landing
  • She has set them up in an inn in Middle Dura, called Gallanda Hall
  • She has provided a writ of enforcement to the group to show that they are on official business

Upon further pressing her for information, she also reveals:

  • That she is on the take from the Boromar Clan and they are interested in what is happening in Old Sharn
  • She is trying to avoid getting the City Watch in the middle of a conflict between Daask and Boromar

docs.title: Why us?
docs.text:
The group sets out to the inn to prepare for their meeting with Coal and checkout their accommodations. On the way they each talk about their connection to the Sergeant and why they may have been called upon for this task. They seem suspicious that this group was put together for such a task.

Before heading out to meet with Coal they make a stop to do some shopping. Each member purchases a Feather Token.

Feather Token

Wonderous item, common

This small metal disk is inscribed with the image of a feather. When you fall at least 20 feet while the token is on your person, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. The token's magic is expended after you land, whereupon the disk becomes nonmagical.

docs.title: A bar, a chase, and a massacre
docs.text:
The group travels to High Walls, a district in Lower Tavick's Landing that is completely surrounded by walls and fortified Sharn City Watch checkpoints are at each bridge crossing. The district is home primarily to refugees of the Last War, primarily former warforged soldiers and Cyrans. It is run down and many of the buildings are falling apart. They find their way to the Cog Carnival and to Coal, who is sitting alone at the bar, mostly through bribes.

Initially on edge by the groups approach, Coal begins to calm down when they produce Vilroy's writ of enforcement. She begins to tell the group about the Daask excavation site, the kidnapping of Caden d'Orien, and the murder of her friend Razor. At that moment, an explosion hits the wall just behind Coal's head, assuming that the group has set her up she makes a break for it and a chase ensues.

The group takes off after her, with some pausing to take in the scene and try to figure out who the assailant was. Renée is able to identify that the attacker was a kobold. During the chase, Renée and Cligs keep after the kobold while Cassian, Caelin, and S.A.M. continue after Coal. Renée is eventually able to catch the kobold, with assistance from Clig's message. Likewise, Caelin is able to convince Coal via message to stop running and let them help her.

Renée and Cligs interrogate the kobold, Jerry for information. He informs them that his group received a letter from a higher up in Daask with instructions on where and when to find Coal and to eliminate her. He claims not to know anything else. Cligs also liberates Jerry of his Wand of Firebolt.

Wand of Firebolt

Wand, uncommon (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast Firebolt from it.

Regaining Charges The wand regains 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll 1d20). On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Separately, Cassian, Caelin, and S.A.M. catch up and start to talk with Coal. They don't get to talk to her long before the rest of Jerry's hit squad shows up: 3 more kobolds and a shifter named Hound. Combat ensues and S.A.M. quickly dispatches the 3 kobolds with a close range thunderwave. Hound is also quickly eliminated by the trio, with Coal's help.

Renée, Cligs, and Jerry catch up the rest of the group. Jerry, seeing the eviscerated remains of his friends, shares that he doesn't know anything about the excavation site or what is happening there or anything about the child. He tells them that the message was sent to the Whispering Hag Tavern a popular Daask hangout in the Malleon's Gate district of Lower Dura. That the order came from Garra and that Hound has this note in his pocket. Cligs give Coal the decision about Jerry's fate and she quickly dispatches him. She also shares with the group:

  • Razor served with Coal in the Cyran military during the Last War, during which Coal lost her right arm.
  • Razor and Coal had trouble finding work in Sharn, due to the fact that many businesses are reluctant to hire warforged foreigners. The pair became desperate for money.
  • A month ago, Razor told Coal she had a job working on a long-term secret mission for Alden d'Orien, the scion of a dragonmarked house. Warforged from other parts of the city were also recruited to help in the task. The job required physical labor, so Coal's injury prevented her from being able to do the job. Razor planned to save money then buy Coal a new arm so she could work with her.
  • Razor would often come back from work sullen or wounded but never opened up about the job until shortly before she died. Razor confessed that the job was more dangerous than it seemed when she was recruited. Razor was planning to quit before she died.
  • Coal knew that Razor had been killed or died when she didn't return several days ago.

Initially reluctant to go with the group and preferring to leave the city, she finally agrees to accompany them to their debrief with Sergeant Vilroy that evening.

docs.title: We want more money
docs.text:
The group meets up with Vilroy at the inn she set them up in. They present Coal and share all that has happened, Coal also provides her with all of the information that she shared with group. Realizing that this is much bigger than initially thought, Vilroy encourages the group to keep up the investigation and to meet with Alden d'Orien in the morning and diplomatically question him about his involvement.

The group negotiates an additional 25gp each fee for the continued investigation, along with assistance in getting Coal somewhere safe. Vilroy agrees and the group heads off to bed. Not being at all circumspect about it, Cligs invites Vilroy to her room - she accepts.

docs.title: Confronting Alden
docs.text:
The next morning, before they head out, Renée sends a message to her cousin with the information about the Daask hideout. Additionally, Caelin makes a quick stop to stock up on medicinal herbs on their way. The group heads to Mithral Tower to meet with Alden, who is at his home the Unicorn Estate. The guards are reluctant to let the group in, but they are able to convince them through the potential scandal of the information they have and the writ of enforcement.

Meeting with Alden it is clear the man has seen better days, he appears haggard and not as one would expect someone in his position. He initially tries to brush off their questions but under sustained pressure, he breaks. He reveals that his only son, Caden d'Orien, was kidnapped a month ago. Shortly thereafter he was approached by the half-ogre Garra to supply warforged workers under a House Orien cover for an excavation site in Old Sharn. He was told if he went to the Watch or didn't comply Caden would be killed. At this, he breaks down and runs into the house.

Vishtai, his kalashtar assistant, telepathically encourages the group to save Caden, indicating that House Orien would owe them a great debt for doing so. He also gives them the location and a hint at how to operate the means via which Daask is accessing the dig site.

docs.title: Going down?
docs.text: The group make their way to the elevator that Vishtai indicated, finding it occupied with two teenage lovers who demand that they leave them at once. They are eventually persuaded to leave the lift without much fuss. The group discovers the secret Medusa panel that Vishtai indicated and Cligs is able to figure out how the mechanism works and they descend into the depths of the city.

docs.title: Masacre Numero Dos
docs.text:
After the extended elevator ride, the group arrives in a massive cavern that is in almost complete darkness. Using their light sources, they are able to identify a 50ft wide, 10ft deep hole in front of them and they hear from across the gaps what sounds like soft sobs of a child.

The group splits into the stealthy and the not-so-stealthy and each make their way around the hole. The not-so group is ambushed by a quartet of Goblin about halfway around the hole. They manage to quickly turn the group in Goblin-goo and continue on their path. Cligs is able to identify that there is a group of the warforged workers being held captive in the center of the hole. The group frees them and goes to rescue Caden. Cassian is able to break the shackles holding him, and having used a crowbar is able to avoid the poison on them that was keeping Caden in his comatose state. Renée is able to rouse him with a Goodberry, she also shares some with the group.

After rescuing all of these people, they learn the following additional details:

  • Garra was the one who was keeping Caden captive and orchestrating the work
  • It seems that they had found what she was looking for, the ruins of an ancient library and she was able to take a number of books and schema from it.
  • The work being done, the warforged were ordered to close up the entrance and they were being kept here until the goods were out of the city.

docs.title: Demanding Restitution
docs.text:
The group take Caden and a representative of the warforged workers, Anvil, back up to Alden. He is overjoyed to have his son back but doesn't seem that remorseful about the plight of the warforged. He claims to have no knowledge of how they were treated or any deaths that happened. He was trying to keep his son alive. Still, he is persuaded to provide each of the remaining workerss 10gp. He also conveys the following information to the group:

  • Garra is working for someone much higher up in Daask, someone named Niho Koi
  • He knows that she has recovered what she was looking for in the excavation site and that the items are scheduled to leave Sharn for Droaam via lightning rail.
  • He gives them the address of hers in Terminus, Lower Tavick's Landing that was the storage location for the goods
  • He also offers the group a 50gp incentive to keep House Orien out of any report they make to the City Watch. The group successfully convinces him to raise it to 100gp.
  • They are also given a second Feather Token, this one in the shape of a unicorn head, inscribed with the House Orien sigil.

docs.title: To Terminus! If we survive...
docs.text:
Alden d'Orien has taken his son and left Sharn to help the boy recuperate. The group knows that they need to get to Terminus to find the excavated items and stop Garra. Asking Vishtai about the best way to get there, he points them in the direction of Lyrandar Tower, where they can make use of Alden's private skycoach to take them to Terminus.

On their way to the tower, while crossing one of the bridge, they hear a familiar voice above them asking if they need a lift. Sergeant Vilroy is there with a skycoach of her own and she encourages the group to get on and fill her in. They at first seem hesitant to board but still fill her in on what they have been up to since they last met. She again encourages them to board and she will take them to Terminus. Cligs begins to notice that something doesn't seem quite right with "Vilroy" and begins questioning their paramour about their recent rendezvouses. At first "Vilroy" seems to be able to bluff their way through, but on sustained questioning they are flummoxed and instead of confronting the character they choose to jump off the skycoach - luckily clutching a feather token so they are able to safely escape to a lower level. They catch a fleeting glimpse as this impersonator melds into the crowd and notice that their shape has changed - a changeling. What happened to the real Vilroy?

They get back on the trek to find the Orien Skycoach when they are again ambushed by agents of Daask, a quartet of gnolls riding disks of green energy sweep zip between the towers and close in on them. Though the battle takes its toll on them, the group is able to eliminate 3 of the gnolls in short order and the last one flees.

Surely these issues aren't a sign of things to come...

docs.title: Terminus
docs.text:
Finally tracking down the Orien Skycoach and proving to the driver that they are on House Orien business, they are able to make their way to the top floor of Terminus. Terminus, in Lower Tavick's Landing, is named for Terminus Station, a massive House Orien enclave that serves as the endpoint for the Orien lightning rail. It bustles with crowds, pickpockets, con artists, and other criminals looking to take advantage of the city's visitors.

Trying to get to Garra as quickly as possible, the group tries to engage the nearby Sharn Watch in helping in their search, or at least stopping the trains, or maybe directions....anything? Though the guard is too frightened by the prospect of mixing with Daask to get involved himself he does give them directions to the floor where Garra's apartment is located and says he will send word to other Watch stations to be on the lookout for the half-ogress.

docs.title: She isn't getting her deposit back
docs.text:
The group knocks on a series of apartment door but most don't answer. At one of them, an elderly magewright named Martisha shouts at them to go away. Convincing her to hear them out and persuading her to give them information she informs them that Garra is her neighbor and there has been a lot of commotion in the apartment today and she would appreciate it if they kept it down.

The group circles back and is eventually able to get the door open. While exploring they are ambushed by four kenku assassins. In the midst of fighting the kenku are also joined by Nur, a gnoll who was in the other room of the apartment burning documents. The group endures another pitched battle but are thankfully aided by the timely arrival of members of the Watch. Exploring the apartment after the battle the group finds:

  • A badly battered Sergeant Vilroy, who has been rendered unconscious by oil of taggit
  • Records of the warforged that were employed in the excavation project
  • A ticket stub indicating that Garra is leaving on a lightning rail to Wroat in 2 hours

Having been roused by a handy Goodberry, the real Vilroy encourages them to quickly rest up and then get after Garra. She lets them know that there is a lift that will take them to the station level.

docs.title: Who designed this adventure?
docs.text: Vilroy also reminds them to be mindful of more Daask operatives which proves to be an apt warning. They almost immediately encounter a Harpy who attempts to lure them and a group of commoners into jumping over the end of a sky bridge. Luckily most of the group is able to resist her Song and save Cligs and the commoners and defeat the Harpy. They have another run in with a Daask shifter named Bartram and his worg companion but are luckily able to buy their way out of having to fight them. The room that Bartram was guarding also has a halfling tied to a chair who has clear been beaten for information. He initially claims to not know why he is there but eventually confesses to being a Boromar spy that was trying (and failed) to infiltrate Daask. They free him, learn his name is Corrin and he points them towards the lift to the station level.

docs.title: Garra, finally
docs.text:
Having made it to the station platform, the group hears the last call announcement for the lightning rail to Wroat. They are quickly able to accomplish:

  • Securing standard fare tickets on the same train
  • Learn that the first class car has been rented out completely by a half-ogre who has paid for security and privacy, the car is off limits
  • Determine that they need to find a way through both a dinning and a galley car to get to Garra
  • Observe that, if necessary, it would be possible to climb out and on top of the cars

Boarding the train the group attempts to look for Daask sleeper agents but doesn't immediately identify any. Making their way into the dinning car they are seated and start coming up with a plan....or plans? Finally settling on attempting to threaten/convince Garra into giving over the stolen goods. They are able to convince the waitress to deliver a note, a bottle of wine, and a slice of cherry cobbler to Garra. After a lengthy wait, she returns to say that Garra will see them and escorts them to her - ultimately locking them into the car with her.

The conversation goes back and forth between her trying to convince them to either take a bribe to look the other way or join Daask and the group trying to get her to give up. With the group shielding her actions, Cligs is able to cast Sleep on Garra and they get the drop on her. Unbeknownst to them, her invisible Sprite, Rot, has been watching and immediately takes aim at the group. He isn't long for this world as Caelin is able to quickly dispatch him and the group turns their attention back to Garra. In what seems like a completely one-sided battle, a lucky change of pace from their previous encounters, the group is able to quickly and decisively deal with her. They are able to get her chest open and examine it's contents:

  • A collection of books and schemas, the items stolen from the excavation site
  • A feather token
  • 600gp
  • A gem of brightness with 32 charges

Gem of Brightness

Wondrous item, uncommon

This prism has 32 charges. While you are holding it, you can take action and use one of three command words to cause one of the following effects:

  • First Command Word. The gem sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. This effect doesn't expend a charge. It lasts until you take a Bonus Action to repeat the command word or until you use another function of the gem.
  • Second Command Word. You expend 1 charge and cause the gem to fire a brilliant beam of light at one creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Blinded condition for 1 minute. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
  • Third Command Word. You expend 5 charges and cause the gem to flare with intense light in a 30-foot Cone. Each creature in the Cone makes a saving throw as if struck by the beam created with the second command word.

When all of the gem's charges are expended, the gem becomes a nonmagical jewel worth 50 GP.

docs.title: What a day!
docs.text:
The group returns to Gallanda Hall as rain begins to fall across Sharn and it seems like Cligs has had quite the ordeal. She stays in the common room with Cassian and the two of them begin to get hammered. Caelin and S.A.M. bring the chest with the schemas up to their rooms and take a moment to investigate the documents. Unfortunately, Caelin does not appear to be able to read the documents nor determine what language they are written in. Unable to do anything further with these they join the others downstairs.

A short while, and several drinks, later a House Sivis messenger arrives with a telegram for Cligs. The message is from Sergeant Vilroy and thanks them for saving her and says that she will stop by in the morning to deliver payment and will bring an expert to review the materials they recovered. With nothing left to do this day they continue drinking. In the course of the drinking Cassian seems to reveal that he may be hearing voices. The others are obviously concerned but S.A.M. steps in to redirect the conversation and try to stop Cassian from saying more - he also advises the young man to not openly say such things in the future.

docs.title: She's a squealer
docs.text:
The morning arrives and, for most of the party, brings with it a hangover - and Sergeant Vilroy with a smartly dressed elderly human man. Cligs is obviously concerned about another potential changeling so challenges this Vilroy to share something only the real Vilroy would she - she does this by revealing that Cligs is a squealer in bed. Happy that this is the real Vilroy, she lets her continue speaking. She again thanks the group for saving her life and also renders their final payment for their task.

She introduces them to Provost Bonal Geldem of the School of Pre-Galifar Studies at Morgrave University and asks them to show him the items they recovered. S.A.M. pulls out a selection of the documents and lays them out for the Provost who begins examining them. As he is reviewing them he becomes visibly more excited and invested in the document. Finally he reveals that these are ancient pre-Galifar schemas for House Cannith and that they are magically encoded so that they can only be read once you cast the correct spell codeword. He asks to take one with him and for the group to bring the rest to his office that evening and join him for dinner, they agree.

After he departs the group has a few more questions for Vilroy but also establishes a secret phrase to use in case they ever need to verify if she is the real Vilroy or not: bugbear boogers. With that done, she leaves and the group finds ways to kill time.

docs.title: Goblin Delicacies
docs.text: The group takes this opportunity to visit the Bazaar District. Caelin, in particular, is looking for some new equipment. They visit Earoc's Blades, a weaponsmith, and The Golden Helm, an armorsmith, to purchase a new +1 crossbow and studded armor, respectively. While the group was waiting for Khuda, the dwarven armorsmith, to engrave the symbol of Aureon onto their armor, Cligs brings the group to her favorite goblin food stall and introduces them to Sharonda, a friend and the owner of the Green Skewer food stall. Cligs gets one of Sharonda's famous meat skewers for each of her new friends. They seem to enjoy their rat skewers.

docs.title: Another ambush?!
docs.text:
By the time their dinner appointment arrives the skies have truly opened up and the rain is drenching as they make their way to Dalannan Tower to meet with Bonal in his office. On the bridge connecting Kelsa Spire to the University they spot what appears to be a body lying on the ground. Cassian quickly rushes over to see if the person needs help. He can immediately tell that the person is dead as a vicious wound is pouring blood out onto the skybridge and they can't detect any signs of life. Before he can make a more in depth study the group is attacked by a warforged soldier who bears the mark of Karnnath on her head and is wield a battleaxe. Cutter does not seem intent on listening to the group and dives into combat with gusto and spotting S.A.M. working with the "fleshies" calls him a traitor and focuses her ire on him. During the ensuing battle the group hears shouts from around them calling for the City Watch and, eventually, the shrill whistles that announce the coming of the Watch guards.

The group is able to defeat Cutter and, as she falls in battle, they notice a small dragonfly-like construct emerge from her chest and begin to fly off. They try to catch it but are unsuccessful, so Caelin takes aim with their new crossbow and is able to hit and destroy the device. With both threats eliminated but the Watch closing in, they only have a few moments to examine the body. Cassian is able to determine that this is, unforunately, the man they were supposed to meet, Provost Geldem. Cligs notices a fancy journal in a leather pouch that he is clutching and quickly snatches it up.

docs.title: Possibly the worst detective ever
docs.text:
In short order, three members of the City Watch appear pointing their weapons at the group and demanding they immediately lower their weapons and explain themselves. The person leading this group, a well-built dwarf by the same of Sergeant Dolom, doesn't seem to be the best at making connections but it earnest in wanting to understand what has happened ensuring that if the group was involved they are taken into custody. They are able to convince him that they didn't have anything to do with Geldem's death and were attacked by the warforged. He is able to tell them the thing they destroyed after Cutter fell was called a Final Messenger, which is a magic item that warforged can use to send a dying message to a specific person within range. The group also convinces Dolom to allow them to checkout his office with him to see if the item they had given him to look at was stolen.

With S.A.M. distracting Dolom, the rest of the group is able to find out the following information:

  • Using a spell, Caelin is able to see where activity was within the past 30 mins within the office. Bright spots include what appears to be servants setting up the dinner in the office as well as right around his desk. They also see Bonal's fingerprints glowing from Cligs' bag.
  • They snatch up their schema that is sitting out on the desk as well as the notepad that Bonal had been writing notes in
  • Not remembered until later, but Caelin also realizes that there is one extra place setting at the table

docs.title: A cloaked stranger
docs.text:
Having gotten what they can from Geldem's office and Dolom, the group head off to find a place to review their findings out of the rain and prying eyes. They head to the inn that Cligs works at, the Gray Dragon Inn, and sit down to discuss. Caelin shares what information they saw and they examine the notes Geldem had been making. It seems he had started to examine the schema, making notes about it's composition and properties, but wasn't able to decipher the codeword. Cligs also takes this time to share about taking the journal and they investigate this. It's a small (3x6") leather-bound journal that has what appears to be mithral threads woven throughout it's cover that converge into what resembles an ancient House Cannith symbol. Inside the pages appear to be blank and made of a special type of paper that isn't quite paper or leather. Cligs also detects what seems like Illusion magic within the journal.

As they are discussing what to do next, with S.A.M. suggesting that maybe going to House Cannith is a wise course of action, a cloaked stranger enters the tavern and immediately comes up to them, as if they knew exactly who they were. When they approach the table they show a signet ring on their hand, which is that of House Cannith, and deliver the message: "If you would know the truth of Bonal Geldem's murder, go to the Broken Anvil tavern in Callestan at Dawn." Before anyone can respond or ask questions the stranger leaves. S.A.M. quickly gets us to follow the individual pausing in the doorway. He returns moments later and tells the group he didn't see where the figure went. Caelin is suspicious of S.A.M. behavior and realizes the bard isn't quite telling the full truth about what just happened. Unbeknownst to the group, S.A.M. had sent a Message to the figure.

docs.title: You know second cousin Kro?
docs.text: The group makes their way down to Callestan in Lower Dura, a deeply impoverished district of the city known for little City Watch presence and plenty of criminal activity. The Broken Anvil is an oddity in this environment because it is more of an upscale establishment, something you might find in a Middle Ward. As they make their way there in the early hours of the morning they come upon three Goblins blocking their path. It seems that these three Daask members had overheard information at the Broken Anvil about the group and suspects that they might be Boromar operatives. They decide to shake them down for information, and maybe some coin. However, Cligs recognizes their accents as being Darguun goblins from the same city she grew up. The lead goblin, Haraal, says he has a second cousin named Kro and asks Cligs if she knew them from back home. She lies and Haraal believes her. This "connection", along with a few silvers to ease the decision, convinces Haraal to let them pass and that they aren't Boromar, he gets permission from his Hobgoblin overseer, who was lurking in the shadows, Eskeen to let them go.

docs.title: The Aundarian Patron
docs.text:
Making their way into the tavern they approach the halfling matron of the bar and request a table for 5. As she talks to them she glances down at a sheet of paper and back to them, it appears it may have their descriptions written on it. Recognizing the group, she leads them to a table in the back where human female with delicate features is sitting in clothing and adornment that surely standout in Callestan. As she greets them they notice that she is wearing a House Cannith signet ring as well. In the course of their discussion the group learns:

  • Her name is Elaydren Vown d'Cannith, from the Aundair Cannith West branch of the family
  • She was the extra person who was going to meet them with Bonal last evening and she learned from the Watch what had happened.
  • Bonal had been helping her locate a family heirloom from a lost Cannith foundry deep below the city
  • She offers them 1,000gp plus 100gp per diem and the favor of her House for recovering the heirloom

When the group accepts, she asks for the journal. When her signet ring is placed on top of the seal on the journal all of the mithral glows brightly and suddenly the journal is filled with text and drawings. She flips to a specific page in the journal and consults it against a map she pulled out of her cloak. After a few moments she reveals the following information:

  • What they are seeking is an adamantine plate shaped in a seven-pointed star that is roughly hand-sized. It is a schema for an ancient Cannith design but on it's own it has no special power.
  • The lost foundry is 57 levels below Dorasharn Tower's present sewer system. The map will show them the way but first they will need to find the E-213 Valve Cluster to access the Dorasharn sewer system. Beyond that is a sealed door that should take them directly to the foundry.
  • There are other agents of the Lord of Blades about, having destroyed Cutter's final messenger may delay some of them but others will surely be looking for the schema still, and likely the group.
  • She also tells them that Bonal mentioned it would be important to have fire in the sewers but didn't know what for.

Once the deals are set and the group is ready to wrap up, S.A.M. surprises them by giving Elaydren all of the schemas that he was storing that they recovered from Garra (all but the three being held by the other players). She seems grateful for this and hands them to a previously unseen aide. As the group leaves S.A.M. appears to linger behind the rest, ostensibly to give Errana, the halfling hostess, a tip. This raises Caelin's suspicions but they aren't able to determine that anything unusual happened and S.A.M. appears to be completely loyal to Cassian. Unbeknownst to the group, he had sent another secret Message, this one to Elaydren.

Before they head down to the sewers and beyond, the group makes a second quick trip to the Bazaar to acquire a bag of holding and 3 Alchemist Fire potions.

docs.title: Slumming It
docs.text:
Having been briefed by Elaydren d'Cannith and outfitted for the task ahead, the group heads out to find the E-213 Valve Cluster somewhere in Dorasharn Tower in the Malleon's Gate district of Lower Dura. Arriving at Dorasharn Tower the group begins to look for the entrance to the sewers but isn't having much luck. They eventually find a staircase that appears to lead downward, maybe to the sewers? Ultimately they discover it leads to a tailor's shop, the sign above the door reads Nibbur's Fine Tailoring.

Nibbur's shop is an oasis of calm in the district. His clothes, though primarily designed for globinoids, are well made and bear a distinctive style - Caelin is even able to pick out some glammerweave amongst some of the nicest outfits on display. They also notice that behind his counter appears to be a large rusted metal door - maybe what they are looking for?

They question Nibbur, first complimenting his goods and Cassian even placing an order for a custom set of clothes, which seems to please him and make him more open. He shares that he doesn't know where the E-213 Valve Cluster is or what is behind the door as he has never had a reason to find out. He gives them permission to try and open the door, as long as they are careful with his goods.

Cassian is able to force the door open; S.A.M., using his lantern, and Cligs, using her darkvision, inspect the room beyond. It appears to be a large room (roughly 150ft diameter) that is filled with water until about 50ft below them. The smell wafting out is vile and makes Nibbur back away - regretting his choice to let them open it. Looking more carefully they determine that the liquid is more sludge than water and that, suspiciously, the walls appear remarkably clean and free of any kind of grime or fungus. Cligs tosses a scrap piece of fabric into the liquid and notices that it begins to sizzle - not a path they want to take!

While examining this room and discussing the outcome, the group hears a loud banging coming down the stairs followed by a massive bugbear shadowing the entrance. He enters the shop and begins yelling, banging on the counter, and demanding his outfit from Nibbur. Nibbur tries to explain to Mandy that they aren't ready yet and signals to the party to intervene. S.A.M. doesn't seem to want to get involved and is ready to leave the goblin to his fate when Nibbur says he might know someone who can help with their issue. Finally they talk to Mandy and are able to convince him to comeback tomorrow, giving Nibbur time to figure out a solution. Grateful for their help, he tells them that there is a goblin merchant named Skakan who operates out of a nearby Rat's Market and finds most of his "treasures" by exploring the sewers - if anyone would know where the Valve Cluster is it would be him.

docs.title: The Rat's Market
docs.text: Following Nibbur's directions they make their way to an open square amidst the tight tunnels of the district. Here they come upon a merchant loudly advertising him goods spread out over several blankets. A crowd is around him. The group approach and attempt to talk to him but he is focused on making sales. Cligs buys a rusty bell in attempt to get Skakan's attention on them and ask about the Valve Cluster. Skakan says he might know where that is - for 100 silver. They try to haggle but aren't successful and end up paying what he asks. He gives them directions.

docs.title: No one will notice the pile of corpses...
docs.text: Following Skakan's directions the group locates a door marked E-213 Valve Cluster and open it. They take a more cautious posture, for a change, and carefully descend into the sewer. They spot an alcove above the landing at the bottom of the stairs and decide to check it out. Caelin does uppies for Cligs who surprises the warforged that was hiding there to ambush them. Glaive strikes at, but misses, Cligs and demands the journal in exchange for their lives. The group chooses violence and in short order is able to eliminate Glaive and the two shifters that were working for him. Luckily for the group, they are able to intercept his Final Messenger. S.A.M. helpfully (?) piles the corpses in the alcove where Glaive was hiding and then attempts to read the Final Messenger. Having never done this before he doesn't know how to navigate using it but is able to determine from it that Glaive was sending his last moments and location to a superior located in the city, named Saber.

docs.title: Let's be more careful
docs.text: Continuing on following the map that Elaydren gave them they are able to navigate the sewers and eventually come upon a circular metal hatch engraved with arcane runes and a similar mithral symbol as to the one that is on the journal. Abandoning their previous caution, Cligs shoots the door with a firebolt - triggering an acid spray trap that hurts her, Caelin, and S.A.M. Eventually Caelin figures out that the symbol on the journal and door match and appear to be made of the same material. They use mage hand to hold the journal up the symbol on the door and it disarms the arcane wards and the door slides open. The group takes time to rest before heading out and Cligs sets an alarm on the doorway.

docs.title: Creepy crawlies
docs.text:
Navigating the steep shaft, it eventually evens out into a sort of tunnel which finally opens into what feels like a massive cavern completely cloaked in darkness. Caelin communes with the local fungi and asks them to sporulate where there is danger. The group see that most of the ground in front of them seems to be covered with mushroom spurt. Cassian tosses a torch out into the area to see what happens and in the immediate area around the torch the mushroom activity dies down.

Exploring the cavern the group sees that the creature being repelled by the fire appears to be a swarm of large hungry looking beetles. They also come upon a trio of large rats that Cligs tosses a ration to which takes their attention. Eventually they come upon one building that appears more intact, clean, and doesn't seem to have any critters near it. Entering this building Caelin is truck with a feeling of familiarity and investigating further is able to determine this is an ancient temple to Onatar, the god of artifice and the forge. Cligs searches the building further and finds a remarkably intact font which is filled with a crystal clear fluid. She takes a drink and is overcome with a feeling of rest - the liquid grants the benefit of a long rest. Caelin also takes a drink and Cassian bottles the remaining dose up for later. S.A.M. shares some interesting views on the Sovereign and the faithful...

docs.title: Poor iron doggos
docs.text:
Continuing to explore the cavern the group eventually comes up another building that seems to be remarkably in good shape. It also appears to be sealed by metal doors. Exploring around the building they do find that it might be possible to get onto the roof. First, Caelin tries to open the door and Cassian tries to alley-oop onto the roof with a boost from S.A.M. - both attempts are unsuccessful. Using the rubble around it they are able to climb onto the roof and find that one section has a hole in it from rocks that fell onto it. Examining the rubble they see that an metal dog was crushed by the falling debris. Clearing some of the debris to examine it they find that a pentagonal rod is sticking out of his head.

While they are investigating this, Caelin notices two pairs of red eyes watching them from the other side of the building - two more iron dogs - that attack the party. They both initially go after Cligs, who is closest to them, but as they get close to her they seem to decide to ignore her and focus on the others. The group tries to find a way to deactivate or at least convince the Iron Defenders that they aren't a threat but they discern that these creatures are bound by ancient commands to protect this foundry and they don't have the skills or knowledge to command them. During the fight Cligs' alarm goes off. Realizing they have no other choice, they eliminate the two defenders and as each is defeated a circular and square rod is ejected from their heads.

docs.title: Fat loots
docs.text:
The party is able to figure out that the three rods are keys and find the corresponding key holes on the wall. Learning their lesson from earlier, they also realize that the keys are trapped and they need to be entered in the correct order or else trigger the trap. They luckily figure out that the keys go in order circle, square, pentagon and the door opens. Between the foundry and the secret vault they recover the following:

  • 1 suit of scale mail, 3 shields, 1 mace, and 1 longsword of mundane quality worth 100 gp total
  • Two magic items they are unclear on:
  • a cleverly-made chain shirt
  • a well-made rapier that has a flame motif down the blade
  • a sack of 100 pre-Galifar silver coins
  • a sack of 100 pre-Galifar gold coins,
  • 4 gold ingots each worth 50 gp,
  • 3 potions of greater healing, 1 potion of fire resistance,
  • an old map that shows a number of cryptic symbols spread throughout what appears to be ancient depictions of the territory now divided between the Mournland and Darguun
  • and the schema they came for.
